thread.title: Tributes paid to ‘brave’ Devon Royal Marine found dead onboard navy ship in Dubai

author: Zoe Stevens
title: Tributes paid to ‘brave’ Devon Royal Marine found dead onboard navy ship in Dubai
text:
Tributes paid to ‘brave’ Devon Royal Marine found dead onboard navy ship in Dubai Both strangers and close friends have paid tribute to James Holloway, of 42 Commando Share His cause of death is under investigation (Image: Ministry of Defence (MoD)) Share Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Many of people on social media have paid tribute to a young Royal Marine who died onboard a navy ship in Dubai. 
James Holloway, of 42 Commando, based at RM Bickleigh, near Plymouth, died on RFA Fort Rosalie on October 29 while she was moored in the Middle East, reports the Plymouth Herald . 
It is understood that the ship is in the region to play a key role in sustaining the fight against terrorism, drug trafficking, piracy and smuggling east of Suez. His body was repatriated on Wednesday at RAF Brize Norton (Image: Oxford Mail/SWNS) 
Messages have been pouring in on social media for the young marine, whose body was repatriated on Wednesday at RAF Brize Norton. 
Both strangers and close friends have paid tribute to him on social media, describing him as a "brave young man" and a "fine young soldier". 
His cause of death is under investigation but the Royal Navy confirmed his death was not as a result of operational activity. He is believed to have been in his 20s. Read More 4,605 apply to be UK citizens in South West after Brexit vote 
A Royal Navy spokesman said: "We can confirm that Marine James Holloway died aboard RFA Fort Rosalie. 
"The cause of death is still under investigation, however, we can confirm it was not as a result of operational activity. 
"Our thoughts and sympathies are with his family and friends at this sad time.” His death was not as a result of operational activity (Image: Oxford Mail/SWNS) 
Derek Bradshaw wrote on Twitter: "Repatriation of Marine James Holloway today. Could not attend Carterton. 4 Riders and 7 Standards at the "Final Turn". We Will Remember Them." 
Lucy McLean said: "I have just had the sad honour of watch Royal Marine James Holloway reach the final turn as I left work for the day brings life sharply into focus & what sacrifice really means God Bless and thank you." 
Some people simply say: "RIP Royal". Like us on Facebook
